intro: Erythrostemon yucatanensis var. yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and have a distinctive spiral pattern, which is a feature of the Convolvulaceae family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in moist tropical environments.
